Jeff Wu at Chinese Academy of Sciences 2011.JPG | image_size = | alt = | caption = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age |1949|1|15|mf=y}} | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = | fields = [[Statistics]] | workplaces = [[Georgia Institute of Technology]],
[[University of Michigan]] | alma_mater = | doctoral_advisor = [[Peter J. Bickel]] | doctoral_students = | known_for = EM convergence proof, resampling methods, industrial statistics, design and analysis of experiments | awards = [[COPSS Presidents' Award]], [[Shewhart Medal]], [[R. A. Fisher Lectureship]], Deming Lecturer Award | footnotes = Fellow of the ASA, ASQ, IMS, INFORMS and Elected Member, Academia Sinica and NAE }} '''Chien-Fu Jeff Wu''' (born January 15, 1949) is the Coca-Cola Chair in Engineering Statistics and Professor in the H. Milton Stewart School of Industrial and Systems Engineering at the [[Georgia Institute of Technology]]. He is known for his work on the convergence of the [[EM algorithm]],{{cite journal |last=Wu |first=C. F. Jeff |last2= |first2= |date=1983 |title=On the Convergence Properties of the EM Algorithm |url=http://www.jstor.org/stable/2240463 |journal=The Annals of Statistics |publisher=Institute of Mathematical Statistics |volume=11 |issue=1 |pages=95–103 |doi= 10.1214/aos/1176346060|accessdate=11 December 2014}} resampling methods such as the [[bootstrap]] and [[Resampling (statistics)#Jackknife|jackknife]], and industrial statistics, including [[design of experiments]], and robust parameter design ([[Taguchi methods]]). Born in Taiwan, Wu earned a B.Sc. in Mathematics from National Taiwan University in 1971, and a Ph.D. in Statistics from University of California, Berkeley in 1976. He has been a faculty member at the University of Wisconsin, Madison (1977-1988), the University of Waterloo (1988-1993; GM-NSERC chair in quality and productivity), the [[University of Michigan]] (1995-2003; chair of Department of Statistics 1995-98; H.C. Carver professor of statistics, 1997-2003) and currently the Georgia Institute of Technology. He has supervised 40 Ph.D. students"Chien-Fu Jeff Wu", Mathematics Genealogy Project, accessed October 11, 2014 [http://genealogy.math.ndsu.nodak.edu/id.php?id=34328 http://genealogy.math.ndsu.nodak.edu/id.php?id=34328] and published around 160 peer-reviewed articles and two books. "Experiments: Planning, Analysis, and Optimization, 2nd Edition", by C. F. J. Wu and M. S. Hamada, John Wiley & Sons, ISBN 978-0-471-69946-0, accessed April 9, 2012, [http://www.wiley.com/WileyCDA/WileyTitle/productCd-0471699462.html http://www.wiley.com/WileyCDA/WileyTitle/productCd-0471699462.html] "A Modern Theory of Factorial Design", by [[Rahul Mukerjee]] and C. F. J. Wu, Springer-Verlag, ISBN 978-0-387-31991-9, accessed April 9, 2012, [http://www.springer.com/statistics/statistical+theory+and+methods/book/978-0-387-31991-9 http://www.springer.com/statistics/statistical+theory+and+methods/book/978-0-387-31991-9] He has received several awards, including the [[COPSS Presidents' Award]] in 1987,"Committee of Presidents of Statistical Societies: Presidents' Award: Past Award Recipients," National Institute of Statistical Sciences, accessed April 5, 2012, [http://nisla05.niss.org/copss/PastAwardsPresidents.pdf http://nisla05.niss.org/copss/PastAwardsPresidents.pdf]. the [[Shewhart Medal]] in 2008,"Shewhart Metal," American Society for Quality, accessed October 10, 2014, http://asq.org/about-asq/awards/shewhart.html. the COPSS [[R. A. Fisher Lectureship]] in 2011,"Committee of Presidents of Statistical Societies: Fisher Lecture: Past Award Recipients", National Institute of Statistical Sciences, accessed April 5, 2012,[http://nisla05.niss.org/copss/PastAwardsFisher.pdf http://nisla05.niss.org/copss/PastAwardsFisher.pdf]. and the Deming Lecturer Award in 2012."American Statistical Association Deming Lecturer Award", American Statistical Association, accessed September 25, 2012,[http://www.amstat.org/awards/deminglectureraward.cfm http://www.amstat.org/awards/deminglectureraward.cfm]. He has been elected as a fellow of the [[American Statistical Association]],"Fellows of the ASA", accessed April 5, 2012 [http://www.amstat.org/awards/fellowslist.cfm http://www.amstat.org/awards/fellowslist.cfm] the [[Institute of Mathematical Statistics]],"IMS Fellows", Institute of Mathematical Statistics, accessed April 5, 2012 [http://www.imstat.org/awards/honored_fellows.htm http://www.imstat.org/awards/honored_fellows.htm] the [[American Society for Quality]] and the [[Institute for Operations Research and the Management Sciences]]."INFORMS Fellows: Class of 2009", INFORMS online, accessed April 5, 2012 [http://www.informs.org/Connect-with-People/Fellows/INFORMS-Fellows-Class-of-20092 http://www.informs.org/Connect-with-People/Fellows/INFORMS-Fellows-Class-of-20092] In 2000 he was elected as a member of [[Academia Sinica]]."Council of Academia Sinica", Academia Sinica, accessed 18 April 2012 [http://academicians.sinica.edu.tw/03.php http://academicians.sinica.edu.tw/03.php] In 2004, he was elected as a member of the [[National Academy of Engineering]]."NAE Members: Dr. Chien-Fu Jeff Wu", National Academy of Engineering, accessed, April 8, 2012 [http://www.nae.edu/MembersSection/Directory20412/30848.aspx http://www.nae.edu/MembersSection/Directory20412/30848.aspx] He received the [[Shewhart Medal]] of the American Society for Quality"Shewart Medalists", American Society for Quality, accessed April 8, 2012 [http://asq.org/about-asq/awards/honors/shewhart.html http://asq.org/about-asq/awards/honors/shewhart.html] and an honorary degree from the [[University of Waterloo]] in 2008. "UW's convocation graduates 4,378 students, awards 10 honorary degrees", news release, University of Waterloo, accessed April 18, 2012 [http://newsrelease.uwaterloo.ca/news.php?id=4973 http://newsrelease.uwaterloo.ca/news.php?id=4973] In November 1997, he gave the inaugural lecture entitled "Statistics = Data Science?"{{cite web|last=Wu|first=C. F. J. (1997)|title=Statistics = Data Science?|url=http://www2.isye.gatech.edu/~jeffwu/presentations/datascience.pdf| accessdate=9 October 2014}} for his appointment to the H. C. Carver Professorship at the University of Michigan.{{cite web|title=Identity of statistics in science examined|publisher=The University Records, 9 November 1997, The University of Michigan|url=http://ur.umich.edu/9899/Nov09_98/4.htm|accessdate=12 August 2013}} He popularized the term "data science" and advocated that statistics be renamed [[data science]] and statisticians [[data scientists]]. Later, he presented his lecture entitled "Statistics = Data Science?" as the first of his 1998 P.C. Mahalanobis Memorial Lectures.{{cite web|title=P.C. Mahalanobis Memorial Lectures, 7th series|publisher=P.C. Mahalanobis Memorial Lectures, Indian Statistical Institute|url=http://www.isical.ac.in/~statmath/html/pcm/pcm_recent.html|accessdate=18 August 2013}} These lectures honor [[Prasanta Chandra Mahalanobis]], an Indian scientist and statistician and founder of the [[Indian Statistical Institute]]. In Mile, Yunnan, China, a conference was held in July 2014 celebrating Professor Wu's 65th birthday."Building Statistical Methodology and Theory 2014", July 7–9, 2014, Mile, Yunnan, China, http://www.stat.purdue.edu/~sunz/Jeff_2014/index.html In 2014 he gave the Bradley Lecture at the University of Georgia. == References == {{reflist|30em}} == External links == *[http://www.icsa.org/bulletin/issues/ICSABulletin08July.pdf Interview with Jeff Wu, ICSA Bulletin] (pages 36–45) * [http://projecteuclid.org/DPubS?verb=Display&version=1.0&service=UI&handle=euclid.aos/1176346060&page=record Convergence of the EM algorithm] * [http://www.isye.gatech.edu/faculty-staff/profile.php?entry=cw219 Personal page at Georgia Tech] *[http://newsletter.sinica.edu.tw/en/news/read_news.php?nid=745 Recognition of Jeff Wu by Academia Sinica] {{Authority control}} {{Persondata | NAME = Wu, C.
